fr.amap.commons.math.matrix

Class Mat4D

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.amap.commons.math.matrix.Mat4D

  • public class Mat4D
extends Object
    A double precision 4x4 matrix
    Author:
    Julien Heurtebize (julienhtbe@gmail.com)

                           double angle,
                           Vec3D axis)
        Perform a rotation of a 4x4 double precision transformation matrix by the given axis and angle
        Parameters:
        mat4D - The 4x4 matrix
        angle - The angle, in radians
        axis - The 3d vector acting representing the axis
        Returns:
        The given matrix, with the rotation applied

                            double right,
                            double bottom,
                            double top,
                            double near,
                            double far)
        Constructs a square frustum by the given parameters, represents this frustum like a 4x4 matrix
        Parameters:
        left - The left limit
        right - The right limit
        bottom - The bottom limit
        top - The top limit
        near - The near limit
        far - The far limit
        Returns:
        The frustum 4x4 matrix

      • perspective

        public static Mat4D perspective(double fovy,
                                double aspect,
                                double near,
                                double far)
        Constructs and initialize a 4x4 double precision perspective matrix
        Parameters:
        fovy - The field of view
        aspect - The aspect ratio
        near - The near limit of the frustum
        far - The far limit of the frustum
        Returns:
        A perspective double precision 4x4 matrix

      • ortho

        public static Mat4D ortho(double left,
                          double right,
                          double bottom,
                          double top,
                          double near,
                          double far)

        Constructs and initialize a 4x4 double precision orthographic projection matrix.

        An orthographic matrix is represented by a rectangular volume.
        Parameters:
        left - The left limit
        right - The right limit
        bottom - The bottom limit
        top - The top limit
        near - The near limit
        far - The far limit
        Returns:
        An orthographic projection 4x4 matrix

      • lookAt

        public static Mat4D lookAt(Vec3D eye,
                           Vec3D center,
                           Vec3D up)
        Compute a view matrix from the world position of the camera (eye), a global up vector and a target point (the point we want to look at)
        Parameters:
        eye - The eye position as a 3d vector
        center - The target position as a 3d vector
        up - The up direction as a 3d vector
        Returns:
        a 4x4 double precision lookat matrix

        Parameters:
        mat4D - The 4x4 matrix to transpose
        Returns:
        The transposed matrix
